implementation.name: create_user
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint for adding a new user. Receives user data, checks for duplicate email, and delegates user creation to the service layer.
implementation.pseudo_code:
When a POST request is made to /users/ with user data:
    Call get_user_by_email to check if the email is already registered
    IF a user with the email exists:
        Raise HTTP 400 error 'Email already registered'
    ELSE:
        Call create_user in the service layer to add the user
    Return the created user

implementation.name: get_user_by_email
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Checks if a user with the given email already exists in the database. Used to enforce the unique email constraint before adding a new user.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Query the User table for a record with the given email
Return the user if found, else return None

implementation.name: create_user
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Handles the actual creation of the user in the database. Called by the endpoint after validation.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Create a new User model instance with email and name from the input
Add the user to the database session
Commit the session
Refresh and return the new user

missing_implementations: Username must not be duplicate (the code checks for duplicate email, not username)
Age must be in the range 0-150
If work_role is not provided, default to 'developer'
Do not update if the previous email is the same as the updated one
Send email of deactivation to the email address
